Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents a user of the Health Track system. A user can record various types of information about their health, in as many days as they like.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Marcelo Portella
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • hashing

        private java.lang.String hashing(java.lang.String userPassword)
                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Encrypt the user's password with SHA-256. Adds the user ID before password to change the hash.
        Parameters:
        userPassword - the user's password.
        Returns:
        the password hash.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - No algorithm exception.

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String userEmail,
                     java.lang.String userPassword)
              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Authenticate the user login information.
        Parameters:
        userEmail - user e-mail.
        userPassword - user password.
        Returns:
        boolean value (user authenticated or not).
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - No algorithm exception.

      • setUserBirthdate

        public void setUserBirthdate(java.lang.String userBirthdate)
        Set the user birthdate. Convert a String birthdate input to an sql date output. This String need to come in format: yyyy-[m]m-[d]d (optional zeroes of months and days).
        Parameters:
        userBirthdate - User's birthdate.

      • setUserEmail

        public void setUserEmail(java.lang.String userEmail)
        Sets the user e-mail.
        Parameters:
        userEmail - User's e-mail.

      • setUserGender

        public void setUserGender(char userGender)
        Set the user gender (char value). (M)en or (W)omen.
        Parameters:
        userGender - user gender (M or W).

      • setUserHeight

        public void setUserHeight(short userHeight)
        Set the user height value in centimeters.
        Parameters:
        userHeight - user's height.

      • setUserId

        public void setUserId(int userId)
        Sets the user ID.
        Parameters:
        userId - user ID.

        public void setUserName(java.lang.String userName)

      • setUserPassword

        public void setUserPassword(java.lang.String userPassword)
                     throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Sets the user password (hash). Uses hashing() method to encrypt the password with SHA-256.
        Parameters:
        userPassword - User Password.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - No algorithm exception.

      • setUserPhone

        public void setUserPhone(long userPhone)

        userPhone - user phone number.
